sentence.text: Patient 4 (Fig. 2D), a 13-year-old boy, is the brother of patient 3.
He was born with multiple congenital anomalies, including a cleft lip and cleft palate, blepharophimosis, and bilateral ptosis.
His fronto-orbital contour is asymmetric with narrowing in the bitemporal region.
The patient has a flat nasal bridge.
He has retrusion of the frontal eyebrow regions, long eyelashes, micromelia, and clinodactyly and syndactyly of the second and third toes.
He has hypoplastic nipples and umbilicus, narrow shoulders, narrow chest, and a sacral dimple with a small sacral skin tag.
He has an alveolar cleft with an anterior palatal fistula.
Also notable are the residual cleft lip and nasal deformity with some elevation of the lip philtral column compared with the contralateral side and some excess tissue in the vermilion.
There is asymmetry of the left naris.
He has a Sprengel's deformity and hypoplastic scapula.
In 2008, he received ptosis surgery and cleft lip and nasal revision.
He has a history of mild conductive hearing loss bilaterally but, as of 2014, had balanced resonance.
He is learning at grade level and receiving mostly As and Bs.
